intro: Seutera palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's seutera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Seutera palmeri is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
